txt.en: Golodir is concerned that Mordirith's Knights will be taken into Amarthiel's service.

Your allies may be found in Ost Guruth in the Lone-lands, Esteldín in the North Downs, and in places familiar to every people -- Combe for hobbits, the race of Men, and Beornings, and Gondamon for dwarf and Elf-kind.\n\nGolodir has asked you to return to three places where Sara Oakheart has been encountered in the past and speak with allies in those places.

'I do not know who these \qservants from the south\q are, but rumour has reached me that the Knights of Mordirith may be in the south. Perhaps it is they whom she spoke of.

'It worries me that the Knights of Mordirith could be re-claimed as Amarthiel's own foresworn. We must find out where she is going next, but more importantly we need to eliminate the threat of Mordirith's Men. It seems that there are three places to return to that may offer clues to the whereabouts of the Knights: Gondamon in Ered Luin, Ost Guruth in the Lonelands, and Esteldín, the refuge of my people in the North Downs.

'Speak to Mathi Stouthand, Frideric the Elder, and Daervunn, the watch-commander of Esteldín. Tell them I sent you and do as they ask. Report back to me when you are done.'
Golodir is at Gath Forthnír in Angmar.\n\nYou should return to Golodir and tell him the task is completed.
'The Knights of Mordirith must be stopped, [placeholder]. They have been sent abroad to who knows what mischief.'

'Speak to Constable Underhill, Frideric the Elder, and Daervunn, the watch-commander of Esteldín. Tell them I sent you and do as they ask. Report back to me when you are done.'

Speak with allies in Combe or Gondamon, in Ost Guruth, and in Esteldín

'You have done the Free Peoples of Eriador a great service. Thank you.

'While you were gone, I spoke with Laerdan about Amarthiel, and it seems he is the one with whom you should speak. He knows much more about this woman than any other, it seems.

'We will speak more about this shortly.'
